Topic.Title: Down again in an UP market? Where's the cash from Alibaba?

Message.Msg: Good for you Corky. I hope you are smarter than that retarded Corky kid on that show many years back and take your profits. 23% since August. Chump change compared to many stocks. FB has gained more than that in a few weeks. That stock is storming higher on big volume. If you are missing that your not too bright. Stock made a classic double bottom and reversed on huge volume. Doesn't get any easier than that. FB still under owned by funds but they are buying heavily now. YHOO hasshown a lot of distribution the last 2 weeks. IBD accumulation/distribution rating on YHOO is now C- from B- last week. That tells you the big money is selling. If I were you I'd at the very least buy puts on YHOO. They are cheap. Take advantage of the dead cat bounce from Friday. Classic bounce to sell into.

Message.Title: ERROR WHILE RETRIEVING DATA
Message.Msg: Or so we are told. Now, when you sttempt to retrieve Message Board for a given stock from your portfolio, you get this error message. The same page allows you to enter the symbol and retrieve the message board. Sound like a way to slow users down and read more ads? It certainly does to me. It never ends. And the Finance chief calls it "bucket testing". Anyone got a better name?

Message.Title: Yahoo! Japan to Grow 30% This Year PT $14
Message.Msg: While Yahoo! JAPAN faces competition in this division from Japanese eCommerce giant Rakuten, we think that the firm will be able to capitalize on the increase in online spending by consumers. According to research firm Forrester, eCommerce sales are expected to grow over 50% from around JPY 4.9 trillion in 2012 to JPY 7.6 trillion in 2015. [2] This growth will translate to an increase in the transaction value on both Yahoo! Auctions and Shopping, making this segment an important driver of Yahoo! JAPAN's value. We currently have a $14 price estimate for Yahoo! JAPAN, which is around 30% above the current market price. Yahoo owns 35% of Yahoo! Japan.

Topic.Title: Yahoo! Japan to Grow 30% This Year PT $14

Message.Msg: That gives Yahoo Japan a lot of incentive to buy Yahoo's 35% of Yahoo Japan.

Topic.Title: I thought Yahoo Japan's market cap was over $20 bil? Seeking Alpha is usually just krap...

Message.Msg: Yahoo Japan Corporation (YAHOY) market cap $19.18 billion. Yahoo´s part of that is $6.7 billion or under $4 billion after tax. Publishing facts is a well known trick used to manipulate stock price.

Topic.Title: Yahoo! Japan to Grow 30% This Year PT $14

Message.Msg: Yahoo can't lose. They will either get a boatload of cash or their stake will increase by 30% this year.

Topic.Title: I thought Yahoo Japan's market cap was over $20 bil? Seeking Alpha is usually just krap...

Message.Msg: So has Y-Japan dropped recently as it had been over $20 bil.? Note that the Alpha article said only $14 bil so that was my point that they were way off. Yes facts are essential but one can manipulate or limit them in various ways and ergo not tell the full and real story. For example in Gloom's numbers he does not consider that YHOO has a cost basis that will not be taxed and the possibility of change to tax law, tax free split, etc. Even with gloom's numbers that would put YHOO cash at well over $10 bil and still owning 23% of AG, so essentially the YHOO core is trading for zero.

Topic.Title: Yahoo! Japan to Grow 30% This Year PT $14

Message.Msg: No YHOO can't really lose, just its shareholders who have been waiting patiently (or not) for over 4 years for YHOO to show its real value. It just takes too long for YHOO to get anything done to really move the value.

Topic.Title: Yahoo! Japan to Grow 30% This Year PT $14

Message.Msg: YHOO assets in Asia are truly goldmine. It grows everyday by itself. Whatever YHOO will do say sell now (money in the bag now) or sell later (more money if waited), both are positive to YHOO.

Topic.Title: I thought Yahoo Japan's market cap was over $20 bil? Seeking Alpha is usually just krap...

Message.Msg: Actually, the Seeking Alpha article said $14/SHARE valuation. Not $14bil.

Topic.Title: I thought Yahoo Japan's market cap was over $20 bil? Seeking Alpha is usually just krap...

Message.Msg: Yahoo Japan is down about 15% since the September high. The Alpha article said $14 share price not $14 billion market cap. Gloom does take into consideration that Yahoo has a cost basis that will not be taxed. But the possibility of a change to tax law, tax free split, lottery winnings, imaginary IPO price and other non facts he leves for others to count.

Topic.Title: I thought Yahoo Japan's market cap was over $20 bil? Seeking Alpha is usually just krap...

Message.Msg: but gloom everything to you is a rumor right up until it is fact and you have been proved wrong mostly on AG value. $14 a share to YHOO for Y-Japan stake? So Alpha (and you I guess) is saying the 35% YHOO stake is worth $17 bil or so and ergo all of Y-Japan worth approx. $50 bil. ? Makes no sense. I will re-read the article but my point is still that YHOO is worth way more than $20.

Topic.Title: ERROR WHILE RETRIEVING DATA

Message.Msg: I don't think they are making changes for the sake of change. They are obviously trying to make their properties better. With change, some users are happy, some are not. But overall, it's nice to see Yahoo mixing things up and attempting to improve their platforms. Not all users will like it, but every day there are more and more new users who come online and Yahoo will have a better chance to attract them with newer user interfaces.
